V:8
A:8
M:8

The included subtitles were NOT good. They were okay in some parts but then they were just completely nonsensical in some parts. (They used the word "coat" for crash" and often referred to "him" as "her". A lot of the English translations are jumbled, too. What's the point of translating English speaking voices to text anyway?) The ones that Kudremukh posted are even worse, as they're not even in English at all.

I guess you can stumble through it, but it's not ideal. Great documentary though.

Also, to confirm, yes this is the 105 minute (supposedly better) version.

The subs that sedned and micha posted are exactly the same and are not synched up to the video at all. I'm not sure how far off they are but it was more than I could gauge from a quick viewing. The best thing to do if you are going to download this version of the rip, is to just use the titles that are provided. They will get you through it 90%.

Thanks for taking the time to up this dollar! A really good documentary. I enjoyed it even knowing nothing about Formula 1 beforehand.

V 8.5
A 8.5

Of the subs listed, several are in sync but none offered really good English syntax  interpretations, but it was enough to understand from the context. The sub file I used was www.AllSubs.org_senna-2010-dual-audio-3_26815.zip from the allsubs site.  As others have mentioned the doc is not entirely in Portuguese. Some Senna interviews are in English.
